text:
Using JDK1.2 and above, <javac bootclasspath="/path/to/foo.jar"
classpath="/path/to/bar.jar" .../> works properly.  JDK1.1.8's javac does not
have a -bootclasspath parameter, though.  I believe the correct behaviour is
that the classes should be prepended to the classpath.

Sample output from 1.1.8:
    [javac] Compiling 6 source files to
/home/pjanes/devel/current/client/qa/build/classes
    [javac] javac: invalid flag: -bootclasspath
    [javac] use: javac [-g][-O][-debug][-depend][-nowarn][-verbose][-classpath
path][-nowrite][-deprecation][-d dir][-J<runtime flag>] file.java...
creator: peterj@liberate.com
bodewig@apache.org
text:
Fixed in CVS.

First binary without this bug should be the nightly build 2001-03-10.
